chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emma Jeanana-Maria Hardiman

records.addlTxt:
9:46 AM Defendant Emma Jeanana-Maria Hardiman in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Emma Jeanana-Maria Hardiman.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Pollak updates- discovery received, will discuss an offer with the DA.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
3:29 PM Defendant Emma Jeanana-Maria Hardiman in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Emma Jeanana-Maria Hardiman.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring amended complaint.
Arraignment scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:45 am.
